data.enText: trade, especially between countries; the buying and selling of goods and services
data.chText: （尤指国际间的）贸易；商业；商务

simple_means.memory_skill: com- 共同,一起 + merc 商业,交易 + -e

ex.enText: The jewellery firm is just a cover for its illegal trade in diamonds.
ex.chText: 这家珠宝公司不过是进行非法钻石交易的幌子。

ex.enText: The volume of trade with Germany has increased.
ex.chText: 与德国的贸易额增加了。

synonyms.bx: 指具体的某种买卖交易或跨国交易，也可指广泛的贸易。

ex.enText: Business is always brisk before Christmas.
ex.chText: 圣诞节前生意总是很兴隆。

ex.enText: She has set up in business as a bookseller.
I entered into partnership with him to start an export business.
ex.chText: 我与他合伙开始做出口生意。

synonyms.bx: 指各类商业活动，包括制造、买卖产品，或提供服务等，侧重于赚钱。

ex.enText: Banks are the nerves of commerce.
New measures have been adopted to promote local industry and commerce.
ex.chText: 已采取新措施促进地方工商业发展。

ex.enText: The country has been trying to broaden its commerce with other nations.
ex.chText: 该国一直在努力扩大与其他国家的贸易往来。

synonyms.bx: 指商品、服务的买卖，侧重于大规模的商贸活动。

tr: transactions (sales and purchases) having the objective of supplying commodities (goods and services)
social exchange, especially of opinions, attitudes, etc.

example.ex: They have made their fortunes from industry and commerce.

value.def: Commerce is the activities and procedures involved in buying and selling things.
